porting_info.account_number_location: Found on your AT&T bill or online account
porting_info.pin_requirements: Account PIN or last 4 digits of SSN
required_info: Account PIN or last 4 digits of SSN

common_issues.solution: Check your AT&T bill or online account. Account number is typically 12 digits.
common_issues.prevention: Have your latest bill ready before starting the port process

common_issues.solution: Verify you're using the correct PIN or last 4 digits of SSN
common_issues.prevention: Confirm your PIN before starting the port process

common_issues.solution: Ensure all bills are paid and account is active
common_issues.prevention: Check account status before initiating port

port_out_steps.details: Visit att.com and sign in to your account
Find your 12-digit account number on your bill or account overview
Confirm your account PIN or last 4 digits of SSN

port_out_steps.description: Ensure account is in good standing
port_out_steps.details: Check that all bills are paid and account is active

steps.details: Begin port process on Xfinity Mobile website or app
Provide AT&T account number and PIN
Confirm all provided information is correct
Follow Xfinity Mobile instructions to complete port

important_notes: Keep your AT&T service active until port is complete
Do not cancel AT&T service before port is complete
Have your AT&T bill ready for reference

common_terms.porting: The process of moving a phone number from one carrier to another
common_terms.account_number: Unique identifier for your carrier account
common_terms.pin: Personal Identification Number used to verify account ownership
common_terms.port_in: Moving a number to Xfinity Mobile
common_terms.port_out: Moving a number from another carrier

best_practices: Have all required information ready before starting
Keep current service active until port is complete
Don't cancel current service before port is complete
Have a backup phone if possible
Start port process during business hours
